items.title: Labor's hate speech laws on the brink as Coalition raises doubts and Greens reject plan
items.summary: With the Coalition and Greens taking a swipe at the bill, questions exist over how the government could pass hate speech reform.

items.title: 'Descended into madness': A rare message from inside Iran lays bare an activist's fear
items.summary: SBS News has spoken to a protester in Iran, describing authorities shooting at civilians amid the country's internet blackout.

items.title: 'Fighter's chance': Why Juliet is attempting to sail to Gaza again, with more Australians
items.summary: Juliet Lamont hopes to bring aid into Gaza by sea. The last time she tried, she was detained by Israel.

items.title: Adelaide Festival retracts statement on Randa Abdel-Fattah, invites her to next writers' week
items.summary: The Palestinian Australian author said she is considering the invitation to next year's event, after organisers said they apologised "unreservedly".

items.title: Warnings for Australian travellers to the Middle East, as Iran reopens airspace
items.summary: Travellers to countries surrounding Iran have been warned about the risk of "regional conflict, missiles and drones".

items.title: More NATO troops heading to Greenland as 'fundamental disagreement' with US remains
items.summary: The announcement follows Denmark's and Greenland's foreign ministers holding high-stakes talks with US vice president JD Vance.

items.title: Causing cancer and disrupting hormones? The dangerous myths online about sunscreen
items.summary: Online fears about sunscreen are popping up, but the science remains unchanged: it’s safe and protective. Here's what we know.

items.title: Trump says he's been told 'killing in Iran is stopping' as US pulls troops from Middle East
items.summary: Donald Trump has openly threatened to intervene in Iran for days, without giving specifics.

items.title: Wet week ahead as storms and heavy rain set to lash eastern Australia
items.summary: A "sustained period of wet weather" will help ease the immediate bushfire danger, but also raises the risk of flash flooding.

items.title: What would you do if you lost your job? Acclaimed director's new film has a dark answer
items.summary: When your job defines you, losing it can have deadly consequences. At least that's the case in Park Chan-wook's thriller No Other Choice.

items.title: Trump's Iran endgame: What 'winning' could look like
items.summary: The US president says he wants to "win" in Iran. As rhetoric escalates, experts question what that means — and whether military action looms.

items.title: Labor mulls extending hate speech laws to include LGBTIQ+ Australians and others
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has signalled this could occur if the current bill becomes law.

items.title: At least 32 dead after crane collapse causes train derailment in north-eastern Thailand
items.summary: The crane was working on a high-speed rail project when it collapsed and hit the passing train.

items.title: Bushfire property losses top 700 as Victoria premier defends fleeing angry locals
items.summary: Property losses are mounting as fire authorities and residents regain access to communities after a state bushfire crisis.

items.title: How does Australia compare? New passport power rankings revealed

items.summary: The massacre during a Jewish Hanukkah festival — and its aftermath — have made indelible impacts on the country.

items.title: 'I see nightmares': Iran's move that's created a 'graveyard of the living' amid protests
items.summary: Amid more than two weeks of protests in Iran, members of the Iranian diaspora in Australia have expressed concern for their loved ones.

items.title: Michele Bullock joins world central bank chiefs declaring 'full solidarity' with Jerome Powell
items.summary: Donald Trump has, for months, been piling pressure on Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell to lower rates faster, arguing it would support a weakening US economy.

items.title: The secret my dad kept was meant to protect me — it still broke my heart
items.summary: Irene was just a few weeks from giving birth when she uncovered a timely secret about her dad, who lived on the other side of the world.

items.title: Neo-Nazi groups say they will disband ahead of introduction of proposed hate speech laws
items.summary: Organisers of the National Socialist Network and affiliated groups have said the organisations will be shut down to avoid members being prosecuted.

items.title: Eight key changes in Labor's sweeping hate speech and gun laws
items.summary: New offences and penalties could target individuals, including religious leaders, who incite hatred or division. Here are eight changes being proposed.

items.title: 'It'll get worse': Flames aren't the only killer for animals during bushfires
items.summary: Victorian bushfires continue to burn, with one carer warning the real toll on wildlife may only emerge in the weeks ahead.

items.title: Renowned author accused of engaging with paedophiles, sharing child abuse material
items.summary: Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material between 7 and 9 of January.

items.title: No Mob, No Country: the social media account profiting with an AI Indigenous avatar
items.summary: In what some say is already become a disturbing trend, AI Indigenous avatars - digitally created by non-Indigenous people - are claiming to speak with cultural authority.
